docs.lead_paragraph: Reports of new case of infantile paralysis and of deaths in the city made public yesterday by the Department of Health tended further to confirm the official belief that the epidemic was losing strength in Brooklyn and Richmond, and gaining -- gradually, but actually -- in Manhattan, Queens, and the Bronx.

headline.main: FIND HOPE FOR CURE IN PARALYSIS SERUM; Two Hospitals Said to Have Had Results from the Blood of Convalscents. LIMITED SUPPLY AVAILABLE Deaths Show Increase, but New Cases Reported Are Fewer, Due to Sunday Holiday.

docs.abstract: 35 deaths, 132 new cases; two hospitals said to have obtained results from serum which prevent crippling; ten scientists accept call; disease spreads up-State; 86 new cases; man 24 years old dies in Philadelphia
